repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Previously, the fallback logic to ".conf" was located outside of `vim.filetype.match()` and directly within the AutoCmd definition. As a result, `vim.filetype.match()` would return nil instead of ".conf" for fallback cases (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/30100).

Solution:
Added a boolean return value to `vim.filetype.match()` that indicates whether the match was the result of fallback. If true, the filetype will be set using `setf FALLBACK <ft>` instead of `setf <ft>`.

comment_data.body: It’s not clear just from this description what this parameter means. Can we expand the docstring here to explain what “via fallback” means and why it’s relevant to the user? Perhaps link to the relevant docs for `:setf FALLBACK`. Ideally, someone should be able to read the docs here and know what this means/does without needing to read the code.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2783,6 +2783,7 @@ vim.filetype.match({args})                              *vim.filetype.match()*
         (`function?`) A function that modifies buffer state when called (for
         example, to set some filetype specific buffer variables). The function
         accepts a buffer number as its only argument.
+        (`boolean?`) True if a match was found via fallback

comment_data.body: Also seems like there is no test coverage?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2783,6 +2783,7 @@ vim.filetype.match({args})                              *vim.filetype.match()*
         (`function?`) A function that modifies buffer state when called (for
         example, to set some filetype specific buffer variables). The function
         accepts a buffer number as its only argument.
+        (`boolean?`) True if a match was found via fallback

comment_data.body:
is ".conf" an example?
```suggestion
        generic configuration file (e.g. ".conf"). If true, the filetype should
        be set with `:setf FALLBACK conf`, which enables a later |:setf| command
        to override the filetype.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2870,6 +2870,10 @@ vim.filetype.match({args})                              *vim.filetype.match()*
         (`function?`) A function that modifies buffer state when called (for
         example, to set some filetype specific buffer variables). The function
         accepts a buffer number as its only argument.
+        (`boolean?`) Return true if a match was found by falling back to a
+        generic configuration file (".conf"). If true, the filetype should be
+        set with `:setf FALLBACK conf`, which enables a later `:setf` command
+        to override the filetype. See `:help setf` for more information.

comment_data.body:
Should it be a string in case there are other variants in the future?
```suggestion
        (`string?`) "FALLBACK" if a match was found by falling back to a
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2870,6 +2870,10 @@ vim.filetype.match({args})                              *vim.filetype.match()*
         (`function?`) A function that modifies buffer state when called (for
         example, to set some filetype specific buffer variables). The function
         accepts a buffer number as its only argument.
+        (`boolean?`) Return true if a match was found by falling back to a

comment_regular_data.body:
Thanks a lot @gpanders @justinmk for the valuable feedback. I've amended the commit to address your comments. 🙂

FYI, it seems the failing macos clang functionaltest is unrelated; That test is also failing on the master branch.
Yes, that test is flaky and fails all the time. You can ignore it.

In particular, I would like to know the rationale behind the added return value, which seems unrelated to the issue this solves? (The rest of the changes -- moving the fallback into vim.filetype.match -- looks good to me.)

> Please explain the problem being solved in 1-2 sentences.

Hi @justinmk -- Previously, the fallback logic to ".conf" was located outside of `vim.filetype.match()` and directly within the AutoCmd definition. As a result, `vim.filetype.match()` would return nil instead of .conf for fallback cases (#30100).

> the rationale behind the added return value

Hi @clason -- The added return value is needed to choose between `setf <ft>` or `setf FALLBACK <ft>`:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ed76447fb6530604c79da8aa5a66dfb6b31a2b8e/runtime/filetype.lua#L28-L31
Can you document this _in the commit message_ and PR description? I'll have to think about whether such a boolean return is the best way to handle this.
Will help to keep this rebased
do you plan to finish this?

Hi @justinmk, thanks for your attention to this PR.

Do you still recommend your proposed changes (on Dec 20) based on my earlier response? Thanks!

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(filetype): move fallback logic to `vim.filetype.match()`
